botanical_details.genus: Begonia can be annuals, evergreen or deciduous perennials or shrubs, with fibrous, tuberous or rhizomatous roots and usually asymmetrical leaves, often strikingly patterned, and small or large flowers, both male and female in the same cluster
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Rex begonias are evergreen, rhizomatous perennials grown for their handsome, brightly coloured leaves, rather than the small pale pink or white flowers which may appear in spring, summer or autumn

how_to_grow.cultivation: Requires frost-free conditions and high humidity. Avoid getting water on leaves. See begonia cultivation - houseplants
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by leaf cuttings or sections of rhizome in spring
how_to_grow.pruning: No pruning required just remove dead or damaged leaves
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to the usual glasshouse pests, including glasshouse whitefly
how_to_grow.diseases: May be infected by powdery mildews or grey moulds
